place_description:
PARKING: Two parking lots/options: behind Haraz Coffee House and across the street on Hawthorne (behind 1124 Central Ave).
The country of Yemen is unapparelled to any other place on this Earth. From its breathtaking scenery to its history that dates back to the beginning of man. Yemen is the homeland of our family. As first-generation immigrants, we wanted to honor our heritage. Yemen is where coffee was invented and later flourished in global trade. Roasting and serving coffee is something that is inclusive of all people and cultures, and brings people together. Our coffee is grown from altitudes over 3,000 ft in a mountainous village called Haraz, where our namesake originates.

reviews_data.review_text:
Their pistachio latte was very good! Slightly pricey but worth a try.

I only ordered a take-out so couldn't really tell how it'd feel to sit at the restaurant for a while. However, the place did have good seating area, so it seems like a nice place to go catch up with a friend, work, or just relax & read a book.
Warm, fun little Yemeni Coffee shop with great coffee, really nice chai teas, pastries/small bites, and a cozy atmosphere.
Very nice spot! The coffee is fresh & they offer unique flavors. They also warm baked items.

This place was awesome!  Friendly and helpful staff. It was very unique! Love cultural drinks and shops. It was quite busy. No inside tables free at the time, but still pleasant. Glad they were open late. The music was a little loud my friend said, but I think it helped with the busy atmosphere. It's pricey for sure, but you're paying for an experience :)
It's a super cute and classy coffee house! The baristas were adorable and very lively! I absolutely LOVED the cheesecake and the coffee, great duo!

Pedi cafe caliente pero no estaba caliente era mas azucar que cafe osea agua con azucar porque no se sentia cafe no me. Gusto para nada jamas volvere primera ves y nunca mas y lo ultimo el servicio deja mucho que desear muy mal
So good we need a Raleigh location
Without a doubt the best place to have a coffee and a delicious dessert. They treat you like family.
Nice place to try Turkish coffe and pastries
My go-to coffee shop recently. I always get the harazi mufawar. The bee bites are good too.
Tea lover? This place is a 'must' for you.
Saeed always greets us with a smile and is above accommodating! Very clean and fast service!
Fantastic. Best coffee in charlotte. Possibly in the whole south.  Get the Haraz latte.
very good

NYC coffee snob here. Been going to these new Yemeni Coffee places sprouting up in Charlotte. This morning I tried Haraz. I was very pleasantly surprised.

Their plain Latte was outstanding. No sort of bitter aftertaste at all. it really did have hint of chocolate taste to it. Their Bee Bite bread was also outstanding. Imagine a really soft Challah bread but stuffed with a mildly sweet cream cheese. They give you honey with it but I hate honey. It's great by itself.

Service was professional, efficient, and very quick. The interior is super clean with alot of seating. My only ding is the small complicated to get into parking lot. You can enter the cafe from a back door from the lot or a front door on the main street.

I want to go back to try more things.

What a wonderful experience!  Came with with a dear friend and the atmosphere was on point. We tried a few pastries and shared a pot of Yemen coffee.

It was an amazing experience and will definitely be back again!
My favorite coffee and atmosphere to study
It's a decent-any other new coffee shop vibe. Not sure why there was so much hype. Good decent coffee! That's all I gotta say.

My first time trying Turkish coffee and it was so full of bold, wonderful flavors! The staff were friendly and the service was quick considering the consistently long line. Highly recommend their Harazi Mufawar and their red tea. Can't wait to go back!

Beautiful building and decorations but that's where the compliments stop. Service was rude. No non-dairy options. We ordered many pastries all of which were obviously not fresh. Espresso was burnt. I believe my Chai seriously had soap in it, I've had better chai at Dunkin. The total for 3 drinks and 4 pastries was $50 which normally is never a bother but because nothing in the menu is fresh the price was egregious. I absolutely would not recommend.
Super cool place to hangout. Excellent and friendly service.  My cappuccinos were superb!

Y'all need to try their mosaic cake, it was amazing! I also got their pistachio latte!
My only complaint is that I wished there were more comfy spaces with outlets so I could settle in for longer
We tried a few of the pastries tonight. I would say it's meh. It's not bad, it's not great. Nothing I would go back a second time for.
Highly recommend!! So good!!
The best matcha green tea frappe with honey!!
Its always packed some times its hard to get a seat but other than that 10/10
Great notes and drink choices! Pastries always comes out fresh. Only downside is parking! Always packed, but every time we've gone line moves fairly quickly.
Amazing
The coffee was great!! Been here multiple times and great atmosphere and staff.
Great variety of coffees and teas. Excellent calming vibe.

I am an avid tea drinker and I've never had Yemen tea. I was looking for one shop and happened up Haraz. I got the Yemeni tea, it was delicious. I'm not sure if it was the tea or something else but it gave me energy like i had never experienced before. If you need something to keep you up for awhile and you're not a coffee drinker...I recommend the Yemeni tea. I also got one of their honey bites, sweet and savory. It was a winner.
This place has amazing coffee and pastries
Loved the vibe of this coffee shop. The staff were very friendly. The coffee and dessert were extremely good. Highly recommend.
Fantastic coffee job. Vibes are great, cute cups and good coffee and treats

Been here for four years, so happy to have found my Charlotte coffee shop!  10/10 coffee, amazing menu, pastries/food look terrrific, comfortable and unique atmostphere (not the "new" cookie cutter, hipster vibe-ish kind of thing).  Not street parking, traditional Turkish carafes and whatnot, love love love it!  Super duper impressed and happy to find my spot, if you can't tell :)

I loved this place, authentic. Pasties and coffee's were delicious. It reminded me of my experience  in Qatar and Dubi. This place seems to be popular. IMO,  expect limited seating during the weekend due to customers  enjoying the friendly, relaxing environment.

Honestly I love this place and would frequent it much more often if they had outlets or a power stop along their main seating wall. The sweets are to die for and the coffee and drinks are always on point. Their for-here ware is so nice and I love all the little authentic touches they have. They only have one bathroom and it was pretty dirty on my visit with no TP in the holder all of it was just sitting on the drawer beside the toilet. But over all the place is clean , well lit, I love the hours of operation. I just hope management gets a long extension cord and puts it along the main seating wall for use
Do they sell Dubai chocolate here?
Too bad they don't have the pistachio rolls

The very first Yemeni Coffee shop in the town. I recommend Safron Adeni which is similar to Indian tea. You can also try Arabian and Turkish black tea. There are lots of Cake options, Biscoff and Pistachio are very well known and delicious.
Milkshake was food and so was cofe but if they had a couches I'd love that
The buzzer telling you your order is ready sounds like a bom b about to detonate. So fun! I would eat the coffee angain and again

I found this place on TikTok.  The cafe is very pretty.  However, the service is terrible.  The woman at the register was on her phone against the wall I stood there for a while looking at the menu before she even realized I was there.  I asked her about an item and she just rang it up without saying what it was.  I gave my order and paid while she bagged it.  I asked her about one of the refresher drinks. She explained it curtly and seemed bothered.  It was busy but everyone was seated and had already ordered, there was no line.  Overall, not a good experience.  I ordered some sort of saffron soaked knafeh "cheesecake".  I only know that from when she rang it up.  Plus, the pistachio croissant filled with pistachio cream.  None of this is sweet.  The "cheesecake" is straight cream cheese.  I'm not sure how to eat it, it comes with a syrup.  The pistachio croissant is salty and nutty not a single hint of sweetness.  I'm not mad about it.  It just isn't to my taste.  Everything in the case looked pretty but is very unexpected.  I'm glad I at least tried it but I will not be back.
Overpriced coffee but okay i guess

What an absolute disappointment. Cashier has no place being the face of the cafe. Very bland and not helpful. Our lattes were almost white and tasted like straight up milk. We are so disappointed. We were very excited to try Haraz but this was a total let down. This Haraz is very nice looking but the vibe is of just a regular cafe. Completely lost its Yemeni cafe vibe. We will stick to Qahwah down the road and I recommend you do as well.

EDIT: as we were leaving the server, came to clean up our drinks and realized they were still full and asked if there was something wrong. I said "yes they taste like straight up milk as if it barely has any espresso." All she said was "sorry about that"  grabbed them and walked away.
All pastries were amazing. Was not disappointed! Drinks were good, however, super sugary. Matcha was the only big minus. Too much matcha powder
If you think that most coffee shops are overrated, this is the next level.
Fantastic! This is one of the best places I've been in any city. Their baked goods are phenomenal and their drinks are a must. I will be back every time I can.
If you are searching for the viral pistachio chocolate bar they have it here!
Staff was very helpful with gluten free options for Celiac. Also needed to make a change to the order I placed. Staff was quick and happy to help with the change.
Number one Arabian coffee place in town. Similar to the best ones in Dubai. Staff is a gem! Owner is like my brother!
I was SO excited when I found the "Dubai Chocolate Bar" but it did not live up to the expectations at all. T
Friendly manager awesome  experience will be back

Very nice place, service is good, customer service good,cashier not friendly, but the owner very attentive and kind. Love the food and  coffee . Everything looks delicious, hard to choose one!! I want to try everything from the menu. Definitely I will come back soon!!
Very specific and Middle East oriented, both atmosphere and food. Personally, not for me, but it's authentic in its own way

Our drinks and cake was delicious. We enjoyed the time we spent here. I took off a star due to the overall atmosphere and lack of ambiance. The vibes are too bright inside. The lighting and decor lead me to want a cozy, warm glow with pillows and rugs and low tables. The windows bring in too much bright white light. The music is also a tad too loud and makes it a bit difficult to hold a conversation.

I'd still come back again but I wish the vibes were a bit warmer.

We went during the week after the morning rush! Great croissants, we had the hazelnutand strawberry! I tried the Sana'ani coffee but wasn't a fan of the cardamon. I am a black coffee drinker so switched to the french press instead. The hubs had a Caramel Frappe and enjoyed. Definitely worth the trip! They have lots of options!
Good place.Good stuff,good coffee.Recommended
I went in the morning, but surprisingly it wasn't busy. Great customer service and even better coffee selections. It's the chill vibe for me.

The pumpkin cheesecake was soooooo GOOD! You definitely want to get there as soon as they open to get a good seat. The staff is amazing and very friendly and I enjoyed my caramel macchiato. The ambiance is very nice and soft.

My daughter and I stopped here this morning for drinks and pastries. What a great staple added here in Charlotte. I ordered a Pistachio latte with an additional espresso shot. This was the best Pistachio latte that I have ever had. My daughter ordered a mango smoothie. For pastries and other treats (some were to go)we ordered the strawberry brioche roll, pistachio brioche roll, pistachio milk cake, dulche de leche milk cake and a Dubai chocolate bar which totaled $58.00. The  rolls were delicious but a lot to eat so I had to break mine up into separate parts of the day and it held up well. We have not tried the cakes yet. The place is aesthetically pleasing, service is pretty swift for as busy as they are and the gentleman that  packed our order was very pleasant. We ordered to go because it was super busy. We arrived around 10:20 am and there were no seats. As we picked up our order and was heading out of the door, a table opened and I was able to get some work done while my daughter watched Netflix. Parking was a breeze as I accidentally passed the location but ran into an empty parking lot that took a minute to walk to Haraz. As others have mentioned, if wanting a seat, then you must arrive early, it is busy and lots of buzz so not super work friendly but I placed my earbuds in and got some work done while I sipped.  We will definitely return. I can't say it will be very regular as I live in Fort Mill but a nice treat here and there. I wish they would open a location in South Charlotte.
Great vibes, great coffee and tea with really interesting flavors. And best of all the service was above and beyond for me and our five month old. (Bathroom does have a changing table! )
Great customer service, and delicious drinks + pastries. The vibe is worth coming.
The best coffee and desserts in Charlotte and the staff are so kind
something different, I love Starbucks
Bought some bee bites today to go and found black hair in my honey... they should wear hair nets this is disgusting and disappointing

It was such a great option in place of other coffee shops. We loved the menu options. We ended up ordering saudi saffron coffee with saffron milk cake and pistachios milk cake. Everything was wonderful, so flavorful, and great quality. And they are open till 2am! We will surely return and try rest of their menu options.
Amazing place to sit and have some coffee, ambience is great
The pistachio latte and almond croissant was delicious!!! Would definitely recommend
Absolutely lovely place!!! My favorite cafe! Food and coffee was literally amazing!!!!
Everything is perfect and always on point!! Love this place and the people!!
Nice coffee shop with bakery item.

Great service, great coffee, great food.
Everything I had was based on recommendations. The chi was probably my favorite drink I had and the spinach and feta croissant was so crispy and buttery.

It's a really nice coffee shop with bakery item. The karak chai is not good as it has too much cardamom for a Desi person but the Bee Bites are to die for , so delicious. The spinach croissant is ok , you should pass on that.
Way better coffee and desserts then Starbucks!!! But it ain't cheap.
Haraz coffee has great customer service and a friendly atmosphere.  Great hours also.  They are open late and I enjoy wrapping up the evening with a Haraz Latte and one of their savory treats!
They have the best Saudi coffee

We were lucky to get a table at this bustling shop. The Yemeni coffee wasn't as strong as I'd expected, but the addition of spices in one and coffee husks in another was interesting. The ginger in the Maleki was especially good.

$6 for 16 oz.
Pastries tasted like grocery store pastries and the lattes were so sweet they were undrinkable. Music was loud and hard to have a conversation over. I would never go there again.
Amazing Yemeni tea and coffee, delicious pastries, cozy ambiance, quick service... perfect experience!

The tea is ok.
I was expecting fresh pastries since I heard good things about the pistachio croissant, but it was kinda hard and dry.
One of my favorite places to go and hang out. If you're looking for shop turn into lounge, Haraz would be it.

My latte was extremely hot.  I let it sit with the lid off for 15 mins and it was still scolding hot.  Additionally, most of the tables were dirty as well as the floor.  Only one restroom, which was fairly busy and had to wait on a few times.
Love this place & the coffee and sweets are phenomenal!
My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. Staff is super nice, and they are food allergy friendly (may not list ingredients directly on menu, but very willing to go and find out for me).

Coffee is really good(pistachio latte, haraz mufawar, and karak chai) and so are pastries. I personally like Dubai Chocolate brioche & milk cakes. Staff is very friendly and helpful even though the shop is busy and packed. In terms of atmosphere, it's definitely cozy tbh. The only reason I had to deduct one star due to lack of seating on busy times since this place really needs to expand pretty quickly to accomadate the guests. However, I will come back for sure!

Haraz is my new favorite coffee spot! I have visited 4 times in the last two weeks and every time I leave I am thinking about when I will be back. Ive tried their cappuccino, pistachio latte, and their tiramisu. My all time favorite is the iced pistachio latte with a slice of tiramisu. Best combo ever. The cashier recommended the iced pistachio latte the first time I was here and boy did it not disappoint. Staff is extra friendly and greats me by my name when they see me walk in. Tables are always clean. I am always telling everyone about this place. If you're thinking about trying it out, DO IT! you're welcome in advance :)
Yemeni coffee is not my cup of tea! But give it a try!
Enjoyed my haraz latte! Can't wait to come back soon!

My friend and I visited Haraz Coffee for a nice late night coffee spot to hang. Parking was a bit difficult since it's shared with ShareTea.

We ordered the Raspberry Mosiac Cake, Pistachio Milk Cake, Hot Regular Latte, Dragonfruit Refresher, and Garlic Croissant.

The Raspberry Mosiac Cake was rich, Pistachio Milk Cake was moist and delicious, we both enjoyed our drink choices. I really wanted to try to Bee Bites, but I came back again months later and finally ordered it. I tried the savory one.

I also like that there's a good amount of seating inside and the interior is so sleek.

This was our first visit to Haraz and it will not be the last. Everything about Haraz is amazing. The staff is friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable. The coffee is outstanding!! The baked goods are fresh and flavorful. The decor is top tier. Everything from dine in serve ware to take out packaging is well thought out and coordinated. If you're in the area, stop in. If you're not, make the trip---you won't regret it!

Our order: Harazi Mufawar, salted caramel latte w/oat milk, caramel macchiato, bee bites w/honey, garlic croissant, pistachio cake

Good food and great place
Enjoyed our quick visit on our way to the airport
My only feedback to the management is that Coffee was so hot that I couldn't drink it till half an hour and it was still hot to drink.
So with that temperature it would be difficult to enjoy while dinning in
Please have the coffee temperature cool down a bit before serving.

Now on a positive note
Loved the drinks
We had Saffron Adeni and Maleki
Both are great tasting and definitely would try again on our next trip to Charlotte.
I hope I don't have to wait half an hour to enjoy the Maleki

Staff is great and friendly- they are quick to answer your questions and help with choices

Parking can be a bit difficult
Small parking area
Joyful atmosphere

Absolutely spectacular. Delicious. Loved the Tiramisu, the Saffron milk cake was amazing, and the bread with honey was a delicious touch of savory and sweet. I had the hazelnut frappe as well and I loved that too. My wife recommends the Haraz latte and shaken espresso.
Great pastries and drinks! The staff is kind and takes the time to answer any questions you'll have.

Lots of 2-4 person seating. We shared Turkish coffee. See photo. Saffron milk cake, pistachio milk cake, bee bite (oh my - so good!!) One bathroom. Service was amazing; it's so nice to encounter happy smiling people. .
llh yTrHlkm lbrkh
Haraz Coffee has its own vibe. would come back
One of the best coffee shops in Charlotte, and they stay open very late! Try the iced hibiscus tea and the Zaatar bee bites.
Top-tier Coffee House
Love this place! Cosy atmosphere, tasty food, gorgeous coffee!!!

I love this place. It's one of the places I usually recommend to people who are visiting Charlotte.

Some of my favorites are the pistachio latte, berry milk cake, and cheesecake.

The pistachio latte isn't very sweet but it's unique. Berry milk cake is soft and moist. The cheese cake is decadent, sweet, and I love the knafeh on top.

Just be warned, this place gets so crowded at certain times and parking can also get tricky.

The staff definitely need some training or more assistance because one coffee order can take up to 30 minutes during busy times and they might forget your order all together.

The actual cafe is also on the smaller side so sometimes even finding somewhere to sit/stand can be a challenge during peak times.

I would recommend, but come at a time when it's not too busy!
Super polite, great coffee, great cheesecake, great tiramisu
Very nice place ! I always come here to do my work and enjoy the coffee also team members are friendly .

This is a little piece of Yemen in Charlotte! The coffee is amazing and the Chai Karak was perfect on this cold day.
I love that they serve their coffee in glass.

I'm sad to write this review because I really liked this place in the beginning but It's getting out of hand how the employees/managers will talk to certain customers for long periods of time when there's a line. Respectfully, you can talk to them later. It's disrespectful to your other customers who are patiently waiting in line to be noticed. Otherwise the coffee is good!
Just left. The coffee is great. The atmosphere is very welcoming. Great little find.

I love haraz! I come here at least once every month to lounge and do homework. It's always so busy though, so you have to go at the right time. I have tried all of the circle brioche there and my favorite is Pistachio and Hazelnut. Favorite coffee is the Pistachio Latte. I get it every time.
Second time here and it was amazing
Great coffee and excellent service!!!

One of the best tea spots in Charlotte. But almost always packed. Kharak Chai is our favorite. The milk cakes are great. Not a huge fan of saffron tea. The service is quick and the employees are quite friendly.

There is parking available but mostly full. Plenty of seating available as well. The coffee is great if you like it strong. Else wouldn't recommend it.
Bee bites were interesting. First bite was meh. But loved it by the end.
The Ambience of the place is great. There is seating available outside as well.

Going on a Saturday, it's hard to find parking, hard to order, hard to find seat, hard to find somewhere to stand. I'm sure there's good things on the menu, but we ended up ordering in the rush we did not like.
Their iced coffees are amazing.
The coffee is very strong, and the cafe is small and busy; they also lack sufficient parking spaces. Just bad I didn't like this place.
Very busy spot, but if you like actual strong coffee and tea this is one of the best spots in Charlotte. They use more spices than your average coffee shop and keep many customers.
It's a good place if you are looking for a chilling area

Very nice location. Being open late is a huge bonus as I'm someone who studies late at night and everything in Charlotte closes early. Comfortable seating in the booths. I have problems with my back so I find it difficult to sit at certain coffee shops for long periods. Got a hot chocolate which was pretty yummy. I was disappointed that they did not have any round croissants or chocolate ones and I came at 6:30pm on a Wednesday. The croissant in the photo was a little overcooked and I requested a new one and the cashier very graciously cooked it perfectly for me the second time. The workers clean your plate off the table for you with a smile. Very nice.  I will be returning.
One of the best coffee shops I've ever visited. Highly Recommend.

The experience was disappointing due to the attitude of the staff. When we inquired about the flat croissants, it was clear they had run out. I asked for clarification if the round, standing-up ones were the flat croissants, but instead of answering politely, the server dismissively repeated they were out. When I tried to clarify further, she curtly said "no" in a tone that felt unnecessarily rude and dismissive.

The desserts were average, the cortado (and presumably the espresso overall) was subpar, and the Turkish coffee was flavored with cardamom, which deviates from traditional Turkish coffee. The music selection--Arabic tunes--was decent but felt a bit too loud for a cafe setting.

Ultimately, the unprofessional attitude of the staff overshadowed everything else and left us with a sour impression.

4.5/5 Stars

The coffee here is truly exceptional--some of the best I've had outside of the Pacific Northwest. The matcha was equally impressive; you could tell they used a high-quality matcha and prepared it with care. Both beverages were easily 5-star quality.

We also tried the pastries, but they didn't meet the same standard. One was mediocre, and the other ended up in the trash after just one bite. The flavor was passable, but the texture was off.

Despite the disappointing pastries, the beverages and service more than made up for it. I'd highly recommend this place for their drinks--they're worth every penny. Overall, a solid 4.5 stars!
dope vibes. cool place. nice culture
Great place to experience middle eastern coffee flavors. Good cakes.
There Arabian blend coffee is good and there cups look cool, but the shop is to small and there wasn't place to set.

bsm llh lrHmn lrHym
This place was incredible, m sh llh. My husband and I really loved it -- though he had been before a few times it was my first time and it lived above its expectations. Honestly, I miss it already. The Dubai cookie was delicious plus it has shredded knefa inside which is just  highly recommend. The owner is such a kind man m sh llh he really cares about his guests :)
Really cool Environment and sweets!

Best coffee in Charlotte, amazing cakes. The atmosphere is good if you can find a seat. Word to management, replace the front area with the over sized club chairs with 4 sets of tables. Also, make the back seating by the elevator more atmospheric like the front

I love coming to this coffee house because they are open so late, the service is always amazing, and the coffee is strong and tasty. The vibe in the shop is cozy and a great place to catch up with friends. It can be kind of noisy so if you are wanting to get some work done or take a meeting... this might not be the right place.

While it can be hard to find a seat here, I completely understand why! My friends and I discovered this spot one late night because we had just ate and wanted to play card games at a coffee shop.

This was one of the only coffee shops open late and it is an absolute vibe. It's loud and busy which is so comforting when you want to hang out and not necessarily just work. If you're looking for a working vibe, this is probably not the spot for you.

Here we've seen tons of friends hanging out, playing cards, laughing and having such a good time.

And the food/coffee is amazingggg. I've had a few sweet treats including the Biscoff cheesecake which was so delicous (highly recommend). I've also had a iced salted caramel macchiato which was tasty and the presentation was even cooler.

The service is pretty fast and efficient, especially for how busy they get.

If you haven't experienced Haraz, go try it out TODAY (or tomorrow lol).

Visiting Charlotte from Taipei. My daughter wanted to go to Haraz to try middle eastern coffee before we head back to Durham. The place is amazing. I love the pistachio mosaic cake but my daughter didn't like her pistachio latte. I even ordered take out - one pistachio and one raspberry mosaic cake.
Cozy place with great pistache latte
Fantastic coffee and pastries.  Loved the place

5 stars for the iced Pistachio Latte
5 stars for the pistachio brioche supreme.

Flavor was TOP NOTCH!
However, So was the price...
$9.25 for the oat milk pistachio latte 

Super tight limited parking but what do you expect...
Love coming here! They have the best pistachio latte in NC, hands down. Service is welcoming and fast, and the atmosphere is very cozy.
This is the cutest Turkish coffee shop! Love the coffee and the food. Friendly staff and the owner runs a few other small businesses in the hood.
The vibe is cool. This place is always packed. Hard to find seats. The coffee and pastries were good. The price is a bit pricey.
Had Safforn spiced coffee
I was impressed with coffee flavors and desserts variety.
Highly recommend trying this exotic coffee shop. The deserts and drinks are entirely unique! Tons of options.
The food, drinks, and service are amazing! But there's not a lot of space and it's very popular. So don't count on getting a table or seat. Be prepared to order everything to go if it's crowded.
Hands down best coffee ever! My to go every morning coffee now! Somebody even remembers my name and always-same-everytime order which is Hot Mocha Latte lol.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Enjoyed the coffee, prices seem high compared to other coffee shops in the area

As some of the other reviewers have alluded to...the presentation is very instagramable but at the end of the day this is just another expensive coffee chain.

Will I be back? More than likely if I am in the area. The coffee was solid and the desserts were good.

Would I go out of my way to get coffee from here? Probably not.

Have tried 8 food items and loved them all. Have tried a coffee and a chai and brought me so much joy. Finally a coffee shop that serves proper hot coffee.
I will be back often!

Used to love Haraz coffee for rich and strong cappuccino and flavorful creamy lattes.
Unfortunately, our last trip was big disappointment.
Regular cappuccino tasted anything but coffee.
Felt like warm milk.
Saffron latte had no hint of coffee. Just milk and honey.
Not sure we will come back...

Haraz is great cafe.
Coffee is good.
Their Karak reminds me of home.
Everybody should experience this place.
Id love to see some savory food items

Thank Heavens you're here! Being an NY transplant, I am always thrilled to experience and taste AUTHENTIC, diverse culture..Ambience is simple, chic. The music is appreciated.  Great spot to get some creative work done.

We had green tea, pistachio mosaic cake and raspberry mosaic cake.
The place was not busy, service was fine, fast.
The cakes on the cabinet look good, tasty.
We sat and chatted for a while.
Overall was good.

Their signature Haraz Frappe and everything else is so amazing. Just in love with this place.
Perfect coffee place so far.
Coffee was good and pastry also
Oh my goodness, everything is amazing here! Lovely atmosphere and delicious beverages and pastries!
The ambiance here is fantastic and cozy; wonderful coffee house feel. The Turkish Coffee is awesome!

One of the best coffee shops I've been to in Charlotte! The atmosphere is amazing and so is the pistachio latte! If you haven't been to Haraz I would definitely recommend getting the Bee Bites. Parking is pretty easy and there are plenty of options on the menu!
Yummiest flavorful food, nice employees and open late ;) (bee bites are the best)

I got a white mocha and cappuccino. White mocha has a great sweetness without overdoing it and the cappuccino was also voluptuous and the espresso came right though. So good! A lil expensive but they use good ingredients
It was a good time. Try each of their pastry

Haraz Coffee House is amazing! I tried the Saffron Adani, Saudi Coffee, and Caramel Frabittino, and all of them were delicious. The Saffron Adani had a rich flavor, and the Saudi Coffee was perfectly spiced. The Caramel Frabittino was smooth and refreshing. Great drinks and a cozy atmosphere! I'll definitely be back!

Haraz Coffee house  - A Hidden Gem!
I recently visited Haraz Coffee and was absolutely blown away by the experience. The coffee here is nothing short of amazing - rich, flavorful, and simply the best I've ever had. The desserts were incredibly fresh and delicious, so much so that I could eat my fingers!
What truly sets Haraz Coffee apart is the exceptional customer service. The staff and owners, especially Hamed and Saeed, went above and beyond to make my visit exciting and memorable. Their warmth and dedication to customer satisfaction are truly commendable.
Haraz Coffee is also a fantastic spot for anyone looking to work or study. The quiet area is perfect for getting things done, and the friendly, soulful environment makes it a pleasure to spend time here. I'm so glad I stumbled upon this place and will definitely be recommending it to everyone I know.
many tables, very good coffee
Lots of great places to sit and work on a computer
Damn good kaffee.    Way it should be.      Wunderbar!
Great coffee, pastries were delicious didn't have time to take photo.
Their pastry was one of a kind. Really enjoyed the ambience of the place and the food was very palatable!
Open late

I feel bad that it's taken me this long to get to Haraz after multiple people have told me how awesome it is. And they're right. This was a lovely coffee break with my wife.

We stopped in Saturday morning and while it was busy, we managed to find a table while I queued for coffee. Two lattes and a tasty looking pastry were very much enjoyed. They go deep on pistachios and walnuts here so if that's your thing, you'll enjoy it.

Super busy, probably not a great spot for laptop work but a fab option for a meetup or just coffee.
Loved it!
Very casual and nice atmosphere. Drinks are excellent. Their triangle chocolates are Amazing.
just an Instagram coffee place. people are nice. but neither coffee nor food is very good. though, they could do much better.
Best coffee in Charlotte.
Fui por primera vez y nos atendieron muy bien tome el cafe tradicional y un pan de fresa estuvo delicioso lo recomiendo y definitivamente regresare

I came from Boston to Charlotte to visit this cafe with my friends. We loved it. It's wonderful to have a place that is open late where you can hang out with friends and enjoy a sweet treat. After living in a Muslim country for 4 years, I really missed late night coffee shops. It's great that they are opening more places like this in the USA. I hope they will open a location in Boston in the future, inshallah.

EDIT (second visit): Reducing the review to 2 stars. For the prices charged, the products haven't satisfied. The Harazi iced coffee has no coffee taste, just unpleasant cardamum. The pistachio latte had a strange taste, mostly just sweetness with no flavor outside of mild pistachio. The pastry again was sub-par, not at all worth the cost. The main issue I have is the prices. $35 for two coffees and two pastries with tip seems very high. Receipt attached.

--

Cappuccino was really nice. Overall nicely decorated location with well-presented products. Efficient staff. Croissant tasted like chemicals and freezer, though, and was tough-textured. Strawberry Brioche was decent but nothing to write home about.

I'd like to try more of their drinks, but I'm not so interested in the pastry anymore.
Beautiful but no GF options :(
I've only had two drinks here so far, but it's the best coffee I've ever had! I will drive across the city just to come get a drink.
10 out of 10 what an amazing place. The pistacho latte had a great taste, you will taste the pistacho. The pistacho milk cake and the berry one was amazing too. Can't wait to come back
Coffee and sweets are awesome.
Amazing coffee amazing owner

I loved this cafe. As an Arab living in the United States, it felt like a piece of home. The interior and entry were lovely. There's available parking, though you might miss it since the entrance is easy to overlook. The cake and pastry were really awesome--especially the milk pistachio cake, wow, I could have eaten two at once! I wish the coffee was better, but overall it's a great spot to study or meet a friend. I do think their prices are overpriced, especially for the Turkish coffee, but it is what it is

It is a highly-rated place, but the customer service was disappointing. The staff seemed confused about my order, and there was no seating available on a Monday at 1 p.m., which was quite odd. I won't be returning--overall, it was a very bad experience.
Authentic selection and good environment, wheelchair accessible and free WiFi

Oh. My. Gosh.
Obsessed. Obsessed is what I am with this place. I first tried it in Dearborn, where it's originally from, and I was in love with the shop there, and now this one is at the same level. The atmosphere is great, although the shop is small it's decorated beautifully and emphasizes the culture and beauty of Yemen. The traditional qawah and chai serving cups are such a special touch. This is unlike any coffee shop you'll go to. They have some of the best espresso I've had, and then paired with the different spices just makes it perfection. The pistachio latte... yall. They get it right EVERY time  I can say that I'm addicted, it's just tooo yummy. Now if you're not a coffee person, the adeni chai??? So creamy and spiced to perfection. I need to know what those spices are because how do they balance so well The Khaliat Nahl is so good and the soft bread paired with the creamy filling is divine. It's perfect paired with a nice cup of coffee. This is definitely a must try when you have the opportunity.

Always got myself a to go - milk cake is to die for
Tried other cakes as well
Love it
Looking forward to try their coffee as well.
Love how unique this is. Great seating, ambience, and selection.
Amazing place to visit and have delicious coffee and lot of choices of croissants and desserts
Worth the wait for some unique coffee options along with beautiful pastries
If I could get coffee here everyday I would! Best coffee in Charlotte hands down.
Excellent selection of interesting coffee beverages. I didn't try any of the food yet. The atmosphere was a bit noisy for my comfort level.

As soon as you walk in you can smell the aroma of goodness! The staff were so nice with explaining the different coffee and pastry options. Let me tell you everything was delicious

https://youtu.be/Dm2O0MVOwsk?si=8Ma1qyGLPxFV3cLF

The salted Carmel latte was delicious as well as the hazelnut pastry. My friend had the Turkish coffee and raved about it as well as the slice of cake that they had. Atmosphere was nice, and there is plenty of seating.

My foodie friend invited me everywhere and she has been ranting and raving about Haraz for some months now. Dope lil coffee shop. And their menu and hours of operation are blowing other coffee spots out of the water at this point. I ordered the pistachio frappe (yes), spinach and feta croissant (hell yea), and the Biscoff cheesecake (Fawk Yea!!). Was not disappointed in the slightest.
we loved this place!! we came visiting from florida and i wish we have a place like this

Finally, Charlotte has a chance to taste Yemeni coffee! If you happily drink Starbucks, don't bother coming here--unless you're ready to experience what real coffee can taste like.  

Great pastries too!

Haraz Coffee: A Bohemian Oasis
Haraz Coffee is a delightful escape from the ordinary. This charming cafe is a haven for coffee connoisseurs and those seeking a laid-back atmosphere. The bohemian decor, with its eclectic mix of colors and textures, creates an instantly inviting ambiance.
The coffee menu is a treasure trove for enthusiasts, boasting a diverse collection of beans from around the world. Each cup is brewed to perfection, offering a unique flavor profile that caters to every palate. Whether you're a purist or someone who enjoys their coffee with a touch of sweetness, Haraz has something to satisfy your cravings.
Beyond the exceptional coffee, the cafe also offers a tempting selection of snacks to complement your drink. The perfect accompaniment to a leisurely afternoon, these treats are as delightful as the coffee itself.
Whether you're looking to catch up with a friend, enjoy some quiet time with a good book, or simply unwind after a long day, Haraz Coffee is the ideal spot. Its cozy atmosphere and friendly staff make it a true gem in the heart of the city.
Highly recommended for coffee lovers and anyone in search of a tranquil retreat.

I got the pistachio latte and my friend got the saffron latte. The pistachio latte was really good but the drinks were SO expensive (almost $10 each). The saffron latte wasn't my favorite. A nice study spot though! Lot of people were studying/working here
Yes yes yes! Love the concept, the vibe, the desserts, the tea. Very enjoyable experience. With I lived closer.
Ordered the pistachio latte and chocolate pistachio chocolate cake. Delicious! Such a cute spot and if you order to have your coffee there, its presented in such a cute set up.

Coffee is good but can't say the same about the service. Customer service needs to be better. I asked one of the girls to please clean our table before our food and coffee comes and she didn't. We had to ask 3 times and she came and gave us an attitude about it.
For anyone who wants to step into another country for an hour while drinking coffee, you've come to the right place

Two stars cause the Ambiance and pastries are great.

We ordered Turkish coffee and Harazi Mufawar. The cardamom flavor was extremely strong. Although I'm accustomed to adding cardamom to my tea, the quantity used in the coffee was still overwhelming.
It felt like we were drinking cardamom syrup with flavor of coffee.
Think twice before ordering a pot of anything.
Cardamom
Beautiful location, culturally refreshing change of pace. Delicious pistachio latte and pastries are to die for. Recommend: biscoff cheesecake. 10/10 good service too!
Great place, seating is just difficult due to the size of the place and popularity.
Authentic Yemeni Coffee! Way to go!

So my mom told me to get one more thing so I went and I got one drink it was cost 7 dollars I gave the guy 20 dollars but he only gave me 1 dollar and like 20 cents back I think he purposely did that because he knew I was a kid and thought I didn't notice.I only noticed when I got home when I was randomly checking the receipt

I love this place great addition to the area! It's beautifully decorated and always clean. I love their milk cakes they are delicious. I have had a few drinks but so far the Pistachio Frappe has been my favorite.

I tried the flat croissant today and it was hard to bite. I was a little disappointed that I was not able to enjoy it.

The staff and service here is great and if you love coffee, tea and pastries like me here is the place to be.

Haraz Coffee Shop is a beautiful place with delicious offerings. However, my recent experience was disappointing. I ordered a matcha, which I found to be much stronger than usual. As a frequent matcha drinker, I was surprised by its intensity and didn't enjoy it as much as I usually do.

In an attempt to adjust the flavor to my liking, I politely asked for a bit more oat milk, for which I had already paid extra. To my surprise, the manager, who had a piercing on her under lip, first requested an additional charge for the extra milk instead of inquiring why I needed it. Her approach felt unpolite and lacked understanding.

I chose not to ask for a replacement matcha, which might have been a more appropriate request given my dissatisfaction with the drink's initial taste. I simply wanted to make my drink more enjoyable by adding more milk.

While I appreciate the quality and consistency of Haraz Coffee Shop's offerings, this experience was somewhat disappointing. I hope in the future, the staff considers customer satisfaction as a priority, especially when the request is as simple as adding a bit more milk to balance out a strong drink.

Friendly staff, exceptional coffee, stellar presentation as far as plating and latte art go--everything was thoughtful. It does get busy even late at night, so come here for community and conversation, probably not for heads down working and reading books. Overall a great experience and a chance to experience cultural influence from middle eastern origins of coffee, tea, and pastry. Loved everything I tried! Raspberry Mosaic Turkish Cake and a Latte both hit!

I have tried Haraz Coffee a few times now and the lattes I've indulged in have always been good, but pricey. $10 for an iced latte, I come here when I want to treat myself lol I've tried the Haraz version, Salted Caramel & Pistachio. The Salted Caramel is my favorite.

I'm a regular who comes in every week and I have to talk about how great of a service Salina has done, she always remembers my order and she's very friendly! Make sure to ask for the pistachio latte, a great place to get it

Wow, loved experiencing their unique countries take on coffee and pastries! The pastries and treats were over the top. The coffee was different, we all loved everything & wish they had a location near where we live! Hope to be back again.

I went for a coffee the other day and i just have to say the employee jacky was exceptional! she was very polite she has had one of the best customer service i've ever experienced i will definitely be coming back thank you jacky! :)
Customer service and cleanliness made it feel like it really was in the middle east. Sloppy barista. Illiterate cashiers. It's not a bros hang out..you guys are at work...act like it.
Love this place, awesome service, food and Atmosphere
delicious pastries and milk cakes and coffee. The arabic tea is like tea in india. Goes very well with their butter croissant

FYI to the uncultured population who say flavors like cardamom are "terrible": Arabic coffee uses spices you may not be accustomed to. Enhance your palate.

This place should not be allowed to serve Saudi or Turkish coffee. The Saudi coffee was overpowered by saffron and no other spices and was ultra watery. It is a shame because anyone who knows true Saudi coffee knows how delicious it is in its true form. The Turkish coffee was another watery joke.

Stick with the Chai Adeni or Mofawar, and beware that it WILL burn your tongue and throat because of the scorching temperature they serve it at!

Paid $16 for a Saudi and Turkish coffee!

The "garlic croissant" = bread with crusty cheese.

This place is a rip-off and only appeals to my cravings for Mofawar and Chai Adeni.
Excellant coffe and baked goods.

I put this in my new category of "Instagram Eateries" where customers are increasingly interested in a shiny atmosphere that lends itself to pretty pictures, but the food and drink are overpriced and (if I'm honest) just okay.  Aside from the fact that my $8 pistachio latte was a shade of green only made possible by artificial colors, it tasted more like a chai latte than anything remotely resembling a pistachio.  And I waited about half an hour to get it.  I've also seen two baristas move through a line of 30-40 people with much more efficiency.  At times, it felt there were as many people "working" behind the bar as there were standing on our side of the register.  What were they doing?  I opted out of a pastry because they looked like a far cry from anything that could be made fresh in house.  I just don't get the hype.

This is the coolest coffee shop I've ever been too and probably the best one as well! The atmosphere of this place is just absolutely wonderful! The plating of your food is beautiful. If I lived closer there would be a weekly stop here, if not daily....
Best coffee in charlotte!
Wow, you guys are amazing! A breath of fresh air, in the middle of nowhere :-)  excuse the rhyme

Me and my friends and I came here to hang out and do a little bit of homework. The place was a bit busy, probably because of the time we chose. It was a Wednesday at around 4 pm. It's a very cozy place to stay at, the prices are affordable, and the staff is very kind. If you go through the enter facing the street, that's where you'll find the register. But if you go around and enter through the back, there is more seating back there, but it is made for more quiet studying. Definitely recommend!!
Love the Adeni Chai and Kinafa cheesecake!! So far enjoyed the chocolate and Zatar croissants. Can't wait to try the bee bites and milk cakes.

The atmosphere was very nice . But small and busy. We ended up ordering to go. We ordered a frozen caramel drink and a maleki coffee which was quite spicy and not sweet at all I'm thinking I suppose to do it myself. The bakery item was fine I like cheese cake with what I think is shredded phyllo dough and some spices on top.Also we got one milk cake. Not sweet as you will think.Overall good but not used to the spices like those on bakery or coffee.

The food and drinks are excellent (albeit pricey) and the coffee shop is an excellent addition to the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. While they are usually very busy the average wait time for your order ranges from 15-30 minutes. I went this morning and noticed a gentleman delivering goods behind the counter with Walmart brand items in Walmart grocery bags. This begs the question of is this is a usual occurrence or if this is a one off.
The coffee and pastries were great.  The service not so great.  Many unbused tables, bathroom and hand washing stations out of order.
The best Coffee
They have the best coffee Ana tea ever

i ordered a caramel macchiato but wasn't expecting a spice taste to it, which to me threw off the flavor of a regular caramel macchiato & tasted kind of bitter as a aftertaste. i was devastated. i understand the theme of this coffee shop but i just didn't think much of a different version of a caramel macchiato. just a heads up to anyone! the inside is very beautiful though :)
Wonderful place, excellent coffee and perfect pastries, the best is the only coffee open until 11:00 pm! If you visited or living in Charlotte you have to go!!
Place was busy. The overall ambiance was good. I ordered the biscotti cheesecake.  It was just ok. I really didn't taste and cheesecake. Got my frappe without sugar and it really good.
Small coffee shop but the coffee is worth it alone. The food was good as well. I will definitely be going back

Really didn't like that I waited over 20 mins to get a pastry that was already prepared. Literally she could have turned around and just handed it to me at the register. Then the waiting area is jam packed and you have to stand over people who are trying to eat. They need a manager to review the process and identify a better way. Making people wait over 20 minutes for items that are already ready to go and simply need to be bagged and handed to the customer is ridiculous. You have people who have to wait for things like coffee or items that need to be prepared but why make someone wait for a ready made item that is literally sitting right next to the cashier. She could have handed it to me in the time it took for my card to process at the register. That was so ridiculous and time consuming. It's like 19 workers behind the register the place is already small so the fact that the waiting line for people who are just grabbing a ready pastry is as long as the foods that need prep is crazy. Also the taste of the item I purchased simply wasn't fresh and the taste wasn't good.

I really wanted to love Haraz Coffee House in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood of Charlotte, but I just didn't. This is simply an Instagram coffee shop. Yes... the things they make and do are pretty. The pastries are pretty. The copper cups for the Turkish coffee are pretty... as are other items they sell. All of this makes for nice pictures. The middle eastern theme is novel for the area, too. I just didn't enjoy anything I ate or drank.... This was the most atypical Turkish coffee I've ever had... watery, weak, light, uninteresting.... All my other Turkish coffee experiences were dark, strong and robust, including the traditional fine grounds at the bottom of the cup. I didn't like the food either... something was just a bit strange with all that I tried.... Including the pastry flake being soggy, not crisp.

To me, this is where you go to take pictures and pretend you're having a great time...and perhaps pretend you're being multi-cultural. If you truly enjoy good coffee, there are better options around with fewer frills.
Muhammad was amazing and great service. Coffee was good and food was good. Will definitely come back.
I love the mocha here, it's so good

SLoW service. I was greeted and told I'll be right with you as this barista was busy riding solo so it seemed. I ordered a latte extra hot and unfortunately it wasn't extra hot as requested upon receipt. it was made again yet again a fail. The lack of detail in the art work needs much improvement. Clean environment with accessible parking in front, side and rear of the building.
I tried the Adenai Chai. It was amazing. The entire place is aesthetically pleasing with excellent beverages and food. I loved the spinach feta pastry!

I went there to have some coffee and desert the coffee was good but the service and the line was bad . I got this cake that was dry and flavorless i had one bite and requested another desert they refused to do so ... paid 9$ for that small piece   ended up waste.

LOVED IT!! Had the Haraz Mufawar coffee and croissants (spinach&feta, milk chocolate and almond)

Croissants were really flavorful and coffee was great!!

Will stop by next time for the pot experience :)
I was impressed by the food and the services received. I had to give them a 4 star just due to lack of seats and parking space.

Excellent! From the tea to the atmosphere to the pastries, this place is a gem! I cannot enough good things how authentic this place is! Keep it up

Can't wait to have this in other major cities. Very fresh products with professional and attentive staff.
The best coffee,  desserts and customer service!!!!!!
This is the best coffee in south and North Carolinas

Coffee was interesting in a wonderful way. I would go back if I was in the area.
The bee bites were just ok, but I'd like to try other options next time.

Found out about this place through IG reels, and since i am big coffee and bakery fan, that place immediately was on my list. We definitely enjoyed Turkish coffee with Turkish cake, and oreo&cream croissant. Wish they had more outdoor sitting since it's very busy inside.
My kind of deliciousness great place and great taste
Coffee and pastries are good. The only thing that I didn't like is that you are forced to have 16oz coffee. So you have to pay $8 for a cup of coffee.
Love this cafe! Great food, friendly staff, and a warm atmosphere. My go-to spot - always feel welcome!
Love it! My new fave coffee shop in Charlotte. Love the taste of the coffee, and bakery items are delicious.

Love this place!! I asked for multiple pastries and coffee and it came out so fast! Even though the space is small, the atmosphere is amazing!
Will be back!
